sentence: What did the gay frenchman say to his boyfriend right before sucking his dick? boner appetit.
explanation: Boner refers to an erection in slang, and can also refer to mistakes or blunders
first_new_sentence: He was embarrassed after experiencing an unexpected boner in the middle of a crowded room.
second_new_sentence: He made a boner when he accidentally sent a personal message to the entire class instead of just one person.

sentence: What time is it when you have to go to the dentist? tooth-hurty.
explanation: Tooth refers to the hard structures in the mouth used for chewing, and also part of the pun here with tooth-hurty
first_new_sentence: The dentist advised that I need to take better care of my tooth hygiene.
second_new_sentence: The tooth fairy is a mythical figure who is said to leave money for children who lose a tooth.

sentence: What do you call a bear that swings both ways? bi-polar.
explanation: Bi refers to being attracted to both genders, while also being a prefix for bipolar disorder, which is a type of mental illness
first_new_sentence: She identified herself as bi to express her attraction to people of multiple genders.
second_new_sentence: He was diagnosed with bi-polar disorder after exhibiting extreme mood swings and emotional highs and lows.

sentence: The defecator. thats not even a real transformer. beat it, kid.
explanation: Beat can mean to defeat someone or something, as well as the rhythmic pattern in music
first_new_sentence: The musician felt the beat of the drum resonate through his body.
second_new_sentence: He knew he couldnt beat the championship record set by the best player in the league.

sentence: Why do ducks try to avoid eating out? theyre always stuck with a bill.
explanation: Bill refers to both the beak of a bird and also refers to a statement of charges
first_new_sentence: The duck used its bill to forage for food in the pond.
second_new_sentence: He could not afford to pay the bill after dining at the expensive restaurant.
